comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Phelps_Taft Charles Phelps Taft (December 21, 1843 – December 31, 1929) was an American lawyer and politician.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton:  Thanks for the more complete name here.  We'll include it next time we update.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Born in Cincinnati like many other other Tafts, retired newspaper man Charles P. Taft -- brother of former U. S. President William Howard Taft -- was in the news in 1914 for having acquired the Chicago Cubs baseball team. He owned it for two years, until 1916.
